alert.note: Alert for Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 4:31PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Butte County through 515 PM PDT... At 430 PM PDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm near Oroville, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...A trained weather spotter reported hail inch hail and ponding of water from torrential rain causing local road flooding. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chico, Paradise, Oroville, Palermo, Thermalito, South Oroville, Magalia, Durham, Oroville East, Concow and Wyandotte. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
